cont.entity_a: Excellent low light performance with image stabilization.
Wide angle to mid-range telephoto focal range makes it versatile for walk-around use.
cont.entity_b: Versatile focal length, great in low light, vivid color, and sharp at 2.8.

cont.entity_a: Super fast and sharp autofocus.
cont.entity_b: Fast and solid lens, great for wide-angle shots.

cont.entity_a: Cost and weight are drawbacks, but it is offered at a discount.
cont.entity_b: Amazing image quality at a low cost and weight.

cont.entity_a: Consistent f/2.8 aperture throughout the zoom range.
Sharper images and solid build quality.
cont.entity_b: Crisp and sharp images, good for beginners.

cont.entity_a: Heavier and larger than the kit lens.

FocalLength.comm: Wide angle works well for landscapes.

cont.entity_a: Great depth of field and range of 17-55mm.
cont.entity_b: Wide angle lens with good build quality.

cont.entity_a: Owned for over 10 years without problems.
Physically large and heavy, but well-built.
cont.entity_b: Solid build with all metal and glass.

cont.entity_a: Beautiful colors and bokeh, minimal distortion.
Great image quality indistinguishable from a full frame body.
cont.entity_b: Amazing image quality at a low cost and weight.

cont.entity_a: Recommended for landscapes and portraits.
cont.entity_b: Great for landscapes and architecture photography.

cont.entity_a: Works well with Canon SL2 (D200).
High-quality lens with great contrast.
Not weather-sealed, but performs well in dusty environments.
Heavy, but manageable with good ergonomics.
Offers great sharpness and clarity in low light.
Great for video with silent operation.
Minimal distortion.
cont.entity_b: Barely perceptible barrel distortion on a crop sensor camera.

Soft around the edges and overpriced.
